title: A Clear Day at the Beach
text: We shall go on to the end, we shall fight in {0}, we shall fight on the seas and oceans, we shall fight with {1} confidence and {1} strength in the air, we shall defend our {2}, whatever the cost may be, we shall fight on the beaches, we shall fight on the {3} grounds, we shall fight in the {4} and in the {5}, we shall fight in the {6}; we shall never surrender, and even if, which I do not for a moment believe, this {2} or a large part of it were subjugated and starving, then our Empire beyond the {7}, armed and guarded by the {8} fleet, would carry on the struggle, until, in God's {9} time, the New World, with all its {10} and {11}, steps forth to the rescue and the liberation of the old.
